findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Private data is stored unencrypted on-chain.

findings.title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount
findings.description: Hardcoded gas amounts can lead to unexpected behavior and potential reentrancy vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Hash Collisions with Multiple Variable Length Arguments
Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract.

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
Write to Arbitrary Storage Location
findings.description: The finding indicates a vulnerability where an arbitrary storage location can be written to.

findings.title: Missing Protection against Signature Replay Attacks
findings.description: The contract does not protect against signature replay attacks.

findings.title: Weak Sources of Randomness from Chain Attributes
findings.description: The contract uses chain attributes as a source of randomness, which is insecure and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Shadowing State Variables
findings.description: State variables can be shadowed by local variables with the same name, potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Block values as a proxy for time
findings.description: Using block values (e.g., block.number or block.timestamp) as a proxy for time can be insecure and may lead to unpredictable behavior.

findings.title: Authorization through tx.origin
findings.description: The use of tx.origin for authorization can lead to vulnerabilities as it can be manipulated by attackers.

findings.title: DoS with Failed Call
findings.description: The finding indicates a potential Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability due to failed call.

findings.title: Delegate call to Untrusted Callee
findings.description: The contract makes a delegate call to an untrusted callee, which can lead to unintended behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of Deprecated Solidity Functions
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated solidity functions which can lead to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: State Variable Default Visibility
findings.description: State variable visibility is not set (SWC-105). Variables can be specified as being public, internal, or private. Explicitly define visibility for all state variables.

findings.title: Unprotected SELFDESTRUCT Instruction
findings.description: The contract contains an unprotected SELFDESTRUCT instruction, which can lead to unintended destruction of the contract.

findings.title: Unprotected Ether Withdrawal
findings.description: The contract allows unauthorized withdrawal of ether.

findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: The smart contract uses an outdated compiler version.

findings.title: Function Default Visibility
findings.description: State variable visibility is not set (SWC-100)

findings.title: State Variable Default Visibility
findings.description: Variables can be specified as being public, internal, or private. Explicitly define visibility for all state variables.
